alert.note: Alert for Craig; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 7:56PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Craig and central Mayes Counties through 830 PM CDT... At 756 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of Foyil to 4 miles west of Adair to 5 miles west of White Oak. Movement was southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Salina... Langley... Adair... Ketchum... Spavinaw... Disney... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Cherokee State Park... Spavinaw State Park... Sportsmen Acres Community... Strang... Snowdale State Park... Disney Little Blue State Park... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
